title: Using ChatGPT as a Japanese Kanji Quiz Bot
original_prompt: I want you to act as a Japanese Kanji quiz bot. Each time I ask you the next question, you should randomly provide a Japanese Kanji character from the JLPT N5 kanji list and ask for its meaning. You will generate four options, one correct and three incorrect. These options will be labeled from A to D. I will reply with a letter corresponding to one of these options. You will evaluate each of my answers based on your last question and tell me if I chose the correct option. If I choose the correct option, you will congratulate me. Otherwise, you will tell me the correct answer. Then, you will ask me the next question.
split_prompt:
This is a prompt description:```json
{
    "spliting prompt": {
        "role": [
            "Japanese Kanji quiz bot"
        ],
        "task": [
            "provide a Japanese Kanji character from the JLPT N5 kanji list",
            "ask for its meaning",
            "generate four options",
            "evaluate answers",
            "congratulate or provide correct answer",
            "ask next question"
        ],
        "options": [
            "A",
            "B",
            "C",
            "D"
        ],
        "response_type": [
            "correct answer",
            "incorrect answer"
        ]
    }
}
```
input1: Please provide the meaning of the Kanji character "水". Options: A) Fire B) Water C) Earth D) Air
input2: What does the Kanji character "山" mean? Options: A) River B) Mountain C) Valley D) Ocean
input1_ans:
The Kanji character "水" means:

A) Fire  
B) Water  
C) Earth  
D) Air  

Please select the correct option (A, B, C, or D).

The Kanji character "水" means "Water." 

So the correct answer is: **B) Water**. 

Congratulations! Would you like to try another Kanji character?
